item.title: Fly-tipped items on footway - Leesons Way, 4th November
item.description:

item.title: The gas board carried out excavations on the 9th June 2025 and again approx a month apart.As you can see both surface areas have deteriorated and is a serious trip hazard.The pavement condition has been caused by the contractors and delivery lorries whilst the flats were being built., 4th November
item.description:
The areas where the gas board filled in after excavations have now sunk and deteriorating and are in two different materials. The pavement is a serious trip hazard as many of the residents are very elderly and walk this route daily. The pavement condition has been caused by the ongoing building works to the new flats (now complete) both deliveries and heavy plant.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ash Close, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Pedestrian button stuck on, 4th November
item.description:
The pedestrian button is stuck on so even when no one is waiting the pedestrian lights come on and as soon as the countdown begins the wait sign is illuminating so it actions the lights to change when not needed causing unnecessary traffic delay
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox on the road, 4th November
item.description:
